<div class="card card--align-left">
    <div class="card__img"><img src="https://placeimg.com/640/480/any" alt="" class="card__img" /> </div>
    <div class="card__contents">
        <h2 class="card__title">
            <a href="#">I'm a Card Title</a>
        </h2>
        <p class="card__body">I'm a body - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.</p>
        <a class="button" href=#>Card button</a>
    </div>
</div>
 
<div class="card {{ 'card--align-' ~ align|default('left') }}">
  <div class="card__img">
    {% if img %}
      <img src="{{- img -}}" alt="" class="card__img"/>
    {% endif %}
  </div>
  <div class="card__contents">
    {% if title %}
      <h2 class="card__title">
        {% if url %}
          <a href="{{ url }}">{{ title }}</a>
        {% else %}
          {{ title }}
        {% endif %}
      </h2>
    {% endif %}
    <p class="card__body">{{ body }}</p>
    {% if button_text and button_url %}
      {% include '@fractal/button/button.twig' with {
        text: button_text,
        url: button_url
      } %}
    {% endif %}
  </div>
</div>
 
{
  "title": "I'm a Card Title",
  "url": "#",
  "body": "I'm a body - Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.",
  "img": "https://placeimg.com/640/480/any",
  "button_text": "Card button",
  "button_url": "#"
}
  • Content: 
    .card {
  border: solid 1px var(--color-gray-lightest);
  padding: 1rem;
  margin: 1rem 0;
}
  • URL: /components/raw/card/card.css
  • Filesystem Path: components/card/card.css
  • Size: 93 Bytes
  • Handle: @card
  • Preview:
    • With layout
    • Component only
  • Filesystem Path: components/card/card.twig

This component requires a nested button component. Fractal, and most other libraries have their own supported syntax for nesting. It looks something like this:

{% if buttons %}
  {% for button in buttons %}
    {% include '@button' with { url: button.url, text: button.text } %}
  {% endfor %}
{% endif %}

Drupal will not be able to use this. Twig namespace support is critical for this to work. Using the Fractal Twig Drupal Adapter in the Fractal instance, and using namespaces to handle nested components is required. So, instead of the above, you’d have:

{% if buttons %}
  {% for button in buttons %}
    {% include "@fractal/button/button.twig" with { url: button.url, text: button.text } %}
  {% endfor %}
{% endif %}

Generally, avoiding nesting, unless it’s necessary sense is a good idea. Too much of it ends up with really complex data structures that make it very difficult to use in Drupal.
